title: Santa Tracker: Where is Santa? See what sports to watch tonight
description: Christmas Day is just a few hours away. Where is Santa? While you wait for him, we have the perfect sports viewing guide.
fullText:
Santa Tracker: Where is Santa? See what sports to watch tonight originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Santa's annual journey from the North Pole is in full swing on Wednesday as millions of families check NORAD and Google‚Äôs Santa trackers to see when his sleigh might reach their neighborhood. The 70-year tradition has turned into one of Christmas Eve‚Äôs most reliable rituals, blending military-grade technology with holiday storytelling.‚Äã

NORAD, the North American Aerospace Defense Command, began tracking Santa in 1955 after a misprinted department store ad sent children calling a Colorado command center looking for St. Nick. Rather than turn them away, officers played along, launching a volunteer-powered operation that has grown into a global Christmas Eve call center and a live-tracking website.

Today, NORAD uses the same¬†radar¬†installations, satellites, and infrared sensors it relies on for air defense to follow Santa‚Äôs movements once he ‚Äúlifts off‚Äù from the North Pole. Officials say the system monitors for the heat signature of Rudolph‚Äôs nose and Santa‚Äôs sleigh as it races across time zones.‚Äã

NORAD‚Äôs tracker goes live early Dec. 24, mapping Santa‚Äôs path in real time as he moves from the International Date Line through the South Pacific, Asia, Europe, Africa, and finally the Americas. Families can watch the map online, use a mobile app, or call and chat with volunteers for location updates throughout the night.‚Äã

NORAD estimates that Santa typically visits homes between about 9 p.m. and midnight local time on Christmas Eve, once children are in bed. Trackers do not pinpoint individual houses, and officials stress that ‚Äúonly Santa knows his route,‚Äù which can change from year to year.‚Äã

The agencies remind families that Santa‚Äôs visit is contingent on kids being asleep, even as maps and live blogs continue to update his progress across oceans and continents. As darkness falls across North America, the tracker tradition becomes a nightly countdown, with one eye on the radar and the other on the clock.‚Äã

Sports fans eager to open their presents and track Santa can keep one eye on the tree and the other on the TV, with football bowls and wall-to-wall NBA action giving them plenty to watch between unwrapping gifts and waiting for the big delivery.

Cavs vs. Knicks 'Dunk the Halls' alt-cast

Sporting events on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day will be spread across multiple networks, including ABC and ESPN. You can also stream select games on the¬†ESPN app,¬†Fubo,¬†Netflix¬†and¬†Prime Video.

Fubo¬†offers a free trial for new subscribers, so you can try the service before you buy. Stream ESPN, ABC, CBS, Fox and 100-plus top channels of live TV and sports without cable. (Participating plans only. Taxes and fees may apply.)

title: Luka Donƒçiƒá set to play his first Christmas Day game as a Laker. Is he enough to pull out a win?
description: Donƒçiƒá will have to put up a Herculean effort on Christmas to right this ship.
fullText:
Luka Donƒçiƒá set to play his first Christmas Day game as a Laker. Is he enough to pull out a win? originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Los Angeles Lakers have been in a bit of a slump as of late. Despite being 19-9 and the 4th seed in the Western Conference, they're 4-5 in December.

This does coincide with some injuries, which makes sense. Of the nine games played in December, the Lakers have been without Austin Reaves for three games and Luka Donƒçiƒá for three and a half, amid many other role players missing time.

This, along with the obvious deficiencies on the roster, has led the team to where they are now.

More:¬†Here are the two ways the Lakers can fix their biggest issues

Austin Reaves made his return on Tuesday night, coming off the bench against the Suns, who absolutely thrashed LA. It was a decent first showing back, as he scored 17 points on 6/11 shooting.

On Christmas Day, the Lakers are set to take on the Houston Rockets at Crypto.com Arena, and from the sounds of it, they'll be getting their other star back as Luka Donƒçiƒá is set to make his return.

As previously mentioned, the month of December has not been kind to the Lakers. Not only are they currently below .500 for the month, but it's the way they've looked in these losses that's concerning.

Of the five games they've lost, they've averaged an 18-point deficit in those losses and have had some abysmal shooting nights, shooting below 20% in two of their last four.

We can‚Äôt play defense and we can‚Äôt shoot 3s

-Lakers now rank 23rd in defense
-Lakers are 28th in 3 point shooting

Not a contender pic.twitter.com/nNKJF9BVpv

‚Äî The Lakers Chip (@Lakerschipp) December 24, 2025

Obviously, this is a much different team without Luka Donƒçiƒá, but are these problems too large for him alone to solve?

The Houston Rockets, while not as good as most expected them to be, are still a problem. They have length, shooting, and depth that will absolutely punish the Lakers on their home court if they're not careful.

Hopefully, for Lakers fans, Luka Donƒçiƒá's return to the lineup, paired with playing on Christmas, gives the team the jolt needed to break out of this slump and deliver a gift to Los Angeles.

Luka Donƒçiƒá playing Santa in Los Angeles this holiday season

What's behind the NBA's best bromance between Luka Donƒçiƒá and Austin Reaves?

JJ Redick saw the All-Star writing on the wall on day one with Austin Reaves.

The Lakers reportedly have a 6'7 trade pivot out of Cleveland

title: James Harden blasted as 'foul baiter' by opposing head coach
description: This is a claim that has followed Harden for years.
fullText:
James Harden blasted as 'foul baiter' by opposing head coach originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Houston Rockets head coach Ime Udoka wasn‚Äôt happy with the undisciplined way that his team defended Los Angeles Clippers guard James Harden during L.A.‚Äôs 128-108 win over the Rockets on Tuesday night.

After the game, Udoka put Harden on blast for intentional foul-seeking and simultaneously admonished his own troops for falling into the veteran guard‚Äôs well-established traps.

Harden finished the game against Houston with 29 points and 13 free throw attempts, 12 of which he converted.

‚ÄúThe undisciplined things of reaching in and fouling,‚Äù Udoka said. ‚ÄúFouled him on three jump shots and then slap down. He‚Äôs a foul-baiter, and you don‚Äôt stay disciplined, show your hands, and reach in. And so, prime example of the things we did well last game or that we need to do against certain guys, and obviously didn‚Äôt come out with that tonight.‚Äù

Udoka is far from the first person to call Harden out for fishing for fouls, but it is a little surprising to hear a coach be so blunt and critical about an opposing player.

Harden has led the league in free throw attempts and makes on a whopping seven separate occasions, so there's no denying that he has a certain knack for drawing contact. While some would classify that as a skill, others like Udoka, might label it differently.

For what it‚Äôs worth, Harden isn‚Äôt the only guard in the league currently facing foul-baiting accusations. New York Knicks guard Jalen Brunson recently responded to similar claims about his style of play by denying them and challenging his defenders to be more disciplined.

‚ÄúI play by the rules. I‚Äôm not a foul baiter,‚Äù Brunson said. ‚ÄúI just play by the rules. Be disciplined on defense. Don‚Äôt reach.‚Äù

Reigning NBA MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander also recently defended himself against claims that he receives a favorable whistle.

"I don't care, not one bit. I can't control how the refs blow the whistle ever,‚Äù Gilgeous-Alexander said. ‚ÄúI've never been able to. Never been a ref. All I can do is play basketball, and that's all I focus on.‚Äù

So again, it‚Äôs not just Harden. Players today are very smart, and many have figured out how to exploit certain rules to their advantage. That might not always lead to the most aesthetically-pleasing brand of basketball, but it has proven to be effective given the way the game is officiated today.

title: Steve Kerr, Draymond Green apologized for mid-game blowup, Warriors coach says; Kerr appreciates beauty in the struggle of 'fading dynasty'
description: Kerr reflected Wednesday on not only the heated exchange with his veteran do-it-all forward but also on the state of the Warriors.
fullText:
An especially introspective Steve Kerr told reporters Wednesday that there's beauty in the struggle while he reflected on the state of his Golden State Warriors and the blowup he had with Draymond Green during the third quarter of a 120-97 win over the Orlando Magic two days earlier.

Kerr and Green were seen in a heated discussion during a timeout Monday night. After an animated exchange, Green decided to remove himself and left for the Chase Center locker rooms.

Although he eventually returned to the bench, he didn't check back into the game.

Draymond Green & Steve Kerr exchange words. 

(via @shubhydoo)

 pic.twitter.com/PEwUkzHNIl

‚Äî Hoop Central (@TheHoopCentral) December 23, 2025

Kerr said he and his do-it-all forward had a "great chat" Wednesday. The longtime Warriors head coach said he and Green apologized to each other as well as to the team.

Kerr explained that it was not his finest hour, nor was it a good look for his group.

"That was a time I needed to be calm in the huddle, and so I regret my actions in that exchange," Kerr said Wednesday.

"These things, they happen, especially when you get two incredibly competitive people like Dray and me. So over the 12 years we've been together, this has happened occasionally, and I'm not proud of it."

Kerr added: "I care so much about Draymond, and the relationship we have is like family. And like family, you go through ups and downs. And my No. 1 goal honestly is for him to finish his career as a Warrior with us fighting ‚Äî metaphorically, not literally ‚Äî and competing together until we're both gone. And I believe that's going to happen because I believe in Draymond, and I believe in myself and I believe in everything we've built for 12 years."

Full soundbite of Steve Kerr on the heated exchange with Draymond Green:

‚ÄúI regret my actions in that exchange and I apologized to Dray, he apologized to me. We both apologized to the team.‚Äù

Kerr reflected on their 12 years of winning together, expressing his belief in Green. pic.twitter.com/xpWhHFwZoA

‚Äî Kenzo Fukuda (@kenzofuku) December 24, 2025

The Warriors famously selected Green out of Michigan State with the 35th overall pick in the second round of the 2012 draft. Kerr has coached him from the 2014-15 season on. Since, Green has emerged as a four-time All-Star, one-time NBA Defensive Player of the Year and nine-time NBA All-Defensive Team member. Together, Kerr and Green have won four NBA championships.

While Stephen Curry and Klay Thompson, and then Kevin Durant, consistently shot the lights out, Green has left his own mark on the organization: with defensive tenacity, heady court vision and physical rebounding, plus timely scoring.

"We have four banners out there, and obviously a lot of people have played important roles in that, but I've said this before, and I truly believe it. I don't think we have any without Draymond. That's how much he impacts winning.

"So his ability to channel that passion, that emotion, that raw rage that he has is a key component to what makes us successful. And what I said about the other night, I didn't channel my own raw emotion and rage, of which there is plenty. We are far more alike than anyone would ever realize."

Kerr cited a long history of turning negative moments into positive momentum during his relationship with Green, who Kerr described as "very complex." While Green has racked up technical fouls and served his fair share of suspensions for outbursts during a 14-season NBA career, he's also known for his basketball acumen and his contemplative commentary.

"We've always, always found a way to not only bounce back, but to make strides as a result," Kerr said, via Warriors reporter Kenzo Fukuda.

With the win over the Magic, the Warriors improved to 15-15. They've won back-to-back games for the fifth time this season. But they've still yet to string together more than three victories in a row.

This version of Golden State is spearheaded by Curry, Green and Jimmy Butler III. They're all at least 35 years old. Butler is a Warriors transplant who helped spark a second-half run last season, which ended in the Western Conference semifinals against the Minnesota Timberwolves after Curry suffered a hamstring strain in the first game of the series.

"Where we are as a team, as an organization, the most important thing for me is for guys to recognize that there's beauty in the struggle. There's beauty in what we're trying to accomplish right now," Kerr said Wednesday, via The San Francisco Standard's Danny Emerman.

"We are no longer the '17 Warriors, dominating the league. We are a fading dynasty. We know that. Everyone knows that. So what is up to us? How do we carry ourselves night to night? How connected are we? And can we give ourselves another swing at the plate? We did that last year. I was really proud of the team last year. Despite the loss to Minnesota, injury to Steph. Who knows how long we would've gone? But we gave ourselves a chance. That's the goal here.

"We know where we are. We've got to know who we are, we've got to know what's possible, and we've got to take pride in the struggle, because this is part of life."

Kerr said he believes sorting out the tiff with Green has been a major step in this Warriors team working through its issues.

He sees an opportunity for Golden State to make another run like last year's.

As for Green, Kerr wants him to finish his career in a Warriors uniform.

"He's undyingly loyal and passionate, and I will go to bat for him as long as I'm coaching him here," Kerr said, per Emerman. "Honestly, I'd go to bat for him 20 years from now when we haven't been together. That's how strongly I feel about him. And that's how I want this thing to end with us, whenever that is."

title: Bears kicker Cairo Santos named NFC Special Teams Player of the Week
description: LAKE FOREST, Ill. (WGN) ‚Äî While Caleb Williams, DJ Moore and the Chicago Bears‚Äô offense received most of the praise for last weekend‚Äôs dramatic, come-from-behind victory over the Green Bay Packers, it would have never happened had it not been for kicker Cairo Santos. In a press release on Wednesday, the NFL announced Santos was [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
LAKE FOREST, Ill. (WGN) ‚Äî While Caleb Williams, DJ Moore and the Chicago Bears‚Äô offense received most of the praise for last weekend‚Äôs dramatic, come-from-behind victory over the Green Bay Packers, it would have never happened had it not been for kicker Cairo Santos.

In a press release on Wednesday, the NFL announced Santos was named NFC Special Teams Player of the Week for Week 16 after his efforts in the Bears‚Äô 22-16 overtime win versus the Packers.

How improbable was the Chicago Bears‚Äô OT win over the Green Bay Packers?

‚ÄúCairo navigating the wind ‚Ä¶ It was just unbelievable with the gusty conditions out there. You guys saw all of the paper cups and all of the things flying and floating all over the field,‚Äù Special Teams Coordinator Richard Hightower said. ‚ÄúFor him to have the mental fortitude to stay focused and play the conditions is what we talk about doing.

‚ÄúNot trying to beat the conditions, not being upset about the conditions, but play the conditions. I thought he did an excellent job of that and struck the ball really well ‚Ä¶ It helped us a ton.‚Äù

Santos converted all three of his field goal attempts in a driving wind‚Äîfrom 46, 51 and 43 yards‚Äîand his lone point-after attempt. He was also the only NFC kicker to score at least 10 points and make 100% of his kicks, including one from 50 yards or longer.

‚ÄúIt was super gusty. It was a tough day today,‚Äù Santos said after the game. ‚ÄúMy first 46-yarder was against the wind, and all the other ones were with the wind. IN the fourth quarter, we were kicking with the wind, but it was more of a crosswind. So, we just had to play a perfect ball and trust it.‚Äù

According to the National Weather Service, wind gusts reached as high as 25-30 mph on Saturday at Soldier Field.

On top of his ten points scored, he also helped Chicago‚Äôs special teams unit recover an onside kick with 1:59 remaining in regulation against Green Bay.

‚ÄúCairo‚Äôs done so much work on campus here, and he‚Äôs done it in the offseason too‚ÄîI‚Äôm talking about all different types of kicks,‚Äù Hightower said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve tried to stop him at times from kicking onside kicks so much, like, ‚ÄòHey, it‚Äôs time to go in.‚Äô And he keeps doing it. There‚Äôs so much work that‚Äôs been put in from that standpoint that it‚Äôs not an accident.

‚ÄúHe put work in for it and he hit a really good ball.‚Äù

His one make from 50+, a 51-yarder in the fourth quarter, was his 25th made field goal of 50-plus yards as a member of the Bears, the most by any kicker in franchise history.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have many words, man. It‚Äôs special to do this with you guys‚Äîcoaches, players,‚Äù Santos said after receiving a game ball from Ben Johnson in the postgame locker room.

Over the last two seasons, under Special Teams Coordinator¬†Richard Hightower, the Bears have earned five¬†Special Teams Player of the Week¬†awards, tied with the Denver Broncos for the most in the NFL.

title: LSU Tigers Have Reportedly Contacted Representatives of Florida Transfer QB DJ Lagway
description: Everyone knows that the LSU Tigers are going to be in the market for a quarterback this offseason, the only question is which one.
fullText:
Everyone knows that the LSU Tigers are going to be in the market for a quarterback this offseason, the only question is which one.

Matt Mascona, of LouisianaSports.net, reported that the Tigers have made contact with the reps of former Florida Gators star DJ Lagway. That immediately solidifies Lagway‚Äôs position on the list of possibilities for next year.

Lane Kiffin and his staff must come away with a new option at quarterback next year. The only scholarship player at the position on the roster is Michael Van Buren Jr.

While Van Buren showed flashes over the last few weeks when he took over for Garrett Nussmeier, but not enough to warrant going into next season with him as the only option.

Kiffin is likely to go big game hunting for one of the top names available.

The most obvious observation to make is bringing over Trinidad Chambliss from the Ole Miss Rebels, but he‚Äôs not guaranteed another year of eligibility.

Arizona State quarterback Sam Leavitt was another top option, coming off a down year but still carrying hopes of having an NFL career. Working with Kiffin could secure that.

If it does come down to Lagway as the choice, it would be an exciting outcome for LSU. He may not have had the best start to his career with the Gators, but he‚Äôs still a high potential player.

Lagway was the top high school passer in a class that included stars like Julian Sayin, Dylan Raiola and CJ Carr. He‚Äôs now one of the top options in the portal.

The Texas native has completed 63.2% of his passes for 4,179 yards with 28 touchdowns and 23 interceptions over his two seasons in Florida.

He‚Äôll have great games and make impressive throws, but no consistency has been developed. It wouldn‚Äôt be crazy to think that Kiffin and his staff could unlock something that the failed Gators crew couldn‚Äôt.

title: Steelers‚Äô Mike Tomlin Earns Lofty Praise From Former Rival
description: Mike Tomlin and Mike McCarthy are two of the most successful NFL head coaches of this century. Both won a Super Bowl, while Tomlin has 200 career wins and counting and McCarthy has 185. McCarthy even won his Super Bowl at Tomlin‚Äôs expense in early 2011, with his Green Bay Packers edging the Pittsburgh Steelers [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Mike Tomlin and Mike McCarthy are two of the most successful NFL head coaches of this century. Both won a Super Bowl, while Tomlin has 200 career wins and counting and McCarthy has 185.

McCarthy even won his Super Bowl at Tomlin‚Äôs expense in early 2011, with his Green Bay Packers edging the Pittsburgh Steelers 31-25 in Super Bowl XLV as Aaron Rodgers outdueled Ben Roethlisberger.

Neither team has been back to the Super Bowl since, although Rodgers and Tomlin have a chance to get there this year in a wide-open AFC.

With Tomlin notching his 200th career win last week and extending his historic streak of seasons without a losing record to 19, McCarthy praised his former rival on Wednesday‚Äôs episode of ‚ÄúThe Pat McAfee Show.‚Äù

"I'm so happy to see Mike Tomlin get the recognition that he deserves..

He's a Hall of Famer and what he's done in Pittsburgh is incredible" ~ Coach McCarthy #PMSLive pic.twitter.com/4SD7UCjZON

‚Äî Pat McAfee (@PatMcAfeeShow) December 24, 2025

‚ÄúI‚Äôm so happy to see Mike get the recognition and love that he deserves,‚Äù McCarthy said. ‚ÄúThis, to me, is the reality of who he is as a coach. To do that for 19 seasons is incredible. You want that in your leader‚Ä¶He‚Äôs a Hall of Famer in my view, and I‚Äôm just really happy for him to see him recognized properly.‚Äù

Tomlin has received a good amount of praise and respect over the last few days just weeks after many fans and media members were calling for the Steelers to fire him. Such is life in the NFL.

The veteran coach has helped turn his team around and get them back on track after a midseason swoon that nearly derailed their playoff hopes. They‚Äôve won three straight games, playing their best football during the biggest games of the year.

If Pittsburgh keeps it up, Tomlin has a good chance to earn his first playoff win in nearly a decade next month.

More Steelers: Mike McCarthy Reveals Steelers-Themed Christmas Wish

The post Steelers‚Äô Mike Tomlin Earns Lofty Praise From Former Rival appeared first on SportsNet Pittsburgh.

title: Eagles Injury Report: Jalen Carter on track to return, Lane Johnson misses practice
description: The latest news on Philadelphia and Buffalo.
fullText:
The Philadelphia Eagles issued their first official injury report in advance of their Week 17 road game against the Buffalo Bills.

The Eagles listed four players under DID NOT PARTICIPATE: Lane Johnson, A.J. Brown, Nakobe Dean, and Landon Dickerson.

For the second week in a row, there was a report about Johnson returning to practice but it‚Äôs yet to happen. Unless Lane Johnson returns to practice on Thursday, he‚Äôs probably out again this week.

Brown is listed with ‚Äúteeth‚Äù as his injury designation. More context below. Guessing he should be able to play.

A.J. Brown said yesterday that he was getting his wisdom teeth out this week, so that could be the reason for his absence. #Eagles https://t.co/W9TILDfNuu

‚Äî Jeff McLane (@Jeff_McLane) December 24, 2025

Vic Fangio suggested that Dean is unlikely to play on Sunday. Don‚Äôt want to rush him back from his hamstring injury, especially with Jihaad Campbell as a more than capable starting linebacker option.

Dickerson missed Wednesday‚Äôs practice due to illness. He‚Äôs been missing some practice sessions in recent weeks due to rest reasons.

The Eagles listed seven players under FULL PARTICIPATION: Jalen Carter, DeVonta Smith, Zack Baun, Jihaad Campbell, Fred Johnson, Cameron Latu, and Cameron Williams.

Carter told reporters he plans on returning to action on Sunday. It remains to be seen just how much the time off helped him.

Jalen Carter said he expects to play on Sunday. He had some shots in his shoulders before missing the last three weeks and is already feeling the benefits.

‚Äî Dave Zangaro (@DZangaroNBCS) December 24, 2025

Jalen Carter said he got multiple shots in both shoulders. He‚Äôs probably not going to feel 100% during this stretch run and will likely have to revisit the injury in the offseason.

‚Äî Jeff Neiburg (@Jeff_Neiburg) December 24, 2025

DeVonta, Baun, Campbell, and Fred Johnson were never in doubt.

Latu missed Week 16 due to a stinger. Seems like he might be able to return in Week 17.

Williams is still in his 21-day practice window to return from injured reserve but the Eagles don‚Äôt seem to be in a rush to replace him.

WR A.J. Brown (teeth)
LB Nakobe Dean (hamstring)
OG Landon Dickerson (illness)
OT Lane Johnson (foot)

LB Zack Baun (hand)
LB Jihaad Campbell (back/ankle)
DT Jalen Carter (shoulders)
OT Fred Johnson (ankle)
TE Cameron Latu (stinger)
WR DeVonta Smith (illness)
OT Cameron Williams (shoulder)

Note that this report is an estimation because the Bills held a walkthrough in lieu of a normal practice.

The Bills listed seven players under DID NOT PARTICIPATE: starting edge rusher Joey Bosa, starting defensive tackle DaQuan Jones, starting safety Jordan Poyer, starting tight end Dawson Knox, rotational tight end Dalton Kincaid, kicker Matt Prater, and depth defensive tackle (and dirty player) Jordan Phillips.

Bosa, who leads the Bills in TFLs and ranks second in sacks, previously missed time due to his hamstring injury but he was removed from the injury report in Week 16. It remains to be seen if this is a new hamstring injury or if it‚Äôs related to his previous one. Something to monitor.

Jones has previously been getting rest in practice so perhaps the Bills are taking it easy with him.

Poyer picked up a hammy injury during the Bills‚Äô Week 16 win. We‚Äôll see if the former Eagles UDFA signing is able to play.

Knox is a new addition to the Bills‚Äô injury report. If neither him nor Kincaid can play, the Bills will be without two of their top three tight ends.

Bills kicker Matt Prater is still hurt so Michael Badgley might have to kick in place of him again.

The Bills listed four players under LIMITED PARTICIPATION: starting quarterback Josh Allen, linebacker Shaq Thompson, starting nickel cornerback Taron Johnson, and backup nickel cornerback Cam Lewis.

All indications point to Allen playing but he might be less than 100%. We‚Äôll see if his mobility is impacted at all.

title: Jerry Jones Hints at Cowboys International Game Coming 'Next Year'
description: The NFL is expecting each team to compete in an international game on a rotational basis. The Dallas Cowboys are due to appear in one, and it could come much sooner than later.
fullText:
The Dallas Cowboys have not appeared in an international game since 2014, which is the longest active streak among any NFL franchise.

With the league now proposing that each team take part in a game on foreign soil at least once every eight years, the Cowboys are next in line to book a trip out of the country for a game. The new rule came about in 2022, so no agreements have been broken yet, but the Cowboys' worldwide fame is a bit surprising that no international exposure has been scheduled yet.

In 2014, it was Tony Romo and Dez Bryant who led a Cowboys team to a 31-17 win in London over the Jacksonville Jaguars. It was the franchise's first and only game played outside of the United States.

Cowboys owner Jerry Jones not only thinks Dallas' next international game is approaching, but that it could be south of the border as soon as next season. The NFL is already planning to host a game next season at Estadio Azeteca in Mexico City in 2026.

‚ÄúI think probably in the near time,‚Äù Jones said about the idea, ‚Äúwith near being next year.‚Äù

We've already looked at the Cowboys' potential 2026 schedule based on them being locked into the No. 2 placing in the NFC East. Dallas is scheduled to host nine games at AT&T Stadium and travel to eight road games.

One of those home contests would have to be sacrificed for an international game. If it comes in Mexico City, we figure that'd be as close to a home-like crowd as you can find outside of Arlington.

Whether it's in North America or Europe, the general expectation is for Dallas to be the home team in this one because they've been voided of the opportunity as a visitor in the past. Home teams in these games get to choose their opponent, and many are smart not to pick a team with such a large fanbase and global brand like the Cowboys with the risk of losing merchandising sales or in-stadium support.

According to ClutchPoints, Jones says that Dallas being the home team in order to score a game is "unavoidable under the current framework," because it's also they will have to rotationally give up a home game and compete internationally anyway.

With this in mind, don't be surprised if "America's Team" takes on foreign soil in the near future.

title: UFC 325 official poster: Alexander Volkanovski looms over Diego Lopes
description: The official poster for UFC 325 has been released ‚Äì and it's a lot of green for Volkanovski vs. Lopes 2.
fullText:
The UFC will kick off its new era with Paramount+ and CBS with two numbered events in January, and the second of those will come "Down Under" with UFC 325.

On Jan. 31 at Qudos Bank Arena in Sydney, featherweight champion Alexander Volkanovski will put his title on the line in a rematch with familiar foe Diego Lopes. The pair first met at UFC 314 in April, with "The Great" earning a unanimous decision victory to claim the vacant belt left behind by Ilia Topuria.

It will be Volkanovski's first appearance on home soil in nearly three years, and his first in Sydney since November 2017. Could Volkanovski (27-4 MMA, 14-3 UFC) be having his last stand against Lopes (27-7 MMA, 6-2 UFC), who is eager to avenge the loss after bouncing back with a highlight-reel finish of Jean Silva in September.

Promotional efforts for UFC 325 are underway. Volkanovski and Lopes had a faceoff at a seasonal press conference this month, and now the organization has released the official poster for the event, which sees the champion looming over the challenger with a heavy tint of green (via X):

title: Warriors' Steve Kerr apologizes for bench argument with Draymond Green
description: Warriors head coach Steve Kerr apologized for role in argument with Draymond Green during a third quarter timeout in Monday's win versus Orlando.
fullText:
It seems all is well between Golden State Warriors forward Draymond Green and head coach Steve Kerr following a Monday argument during a third quarter timeout in their eventual 120-97 win against the Orlando Magic.

Kerr, during a press conference Wednesday, took accountability for the dust up that led to Green briefly walking away from the bench to gain his composure alone in the locker room before returning shortly before the fourth quarter began, despite never taking off his warmups.

"Monday night was not my finest hour and that was a time I needed to be calm in the huddle, and so I regret my actions in that exchange. I apologized to Dray. He apologized to me. We both apologized to the team."

Steve Kerr on Draymond Green: ‚ÄúMonday night was not my finest hour and that was a time I needed to be calm in the huddle, and so I regret my actions in that exchange. I apologized to Dray. He apologized to me. We both apologized to the team.‚Äù

‚Äî Joseph Dycus (@joseph_dycus) December 24, 2025

Green, a four-time champion in 13 seasons with the Warriors, said after Monday's game to reporters that "tempers spilled over".

"I just thought it was best that I get out of there," Green said. "I don't think it was a situation where it was going to get better, so it was best to remove myself."

The cause of the argument Green said was basketball.

"It's what we do," he said. "We play basketball. It's an emotional game. People lose their emotions sometimes, it happens. It is what it is. We've been at this now for a long time. Sometimes you're with people for a long time there's a level of comfort and it happens. We move forward."

Reporters on Monday asked if it was something that would linger on, but Green dismissed it saying they would "move forward".

"We'll move forward, we're alright," Green said regarding his spat with Kerr.

The Warriors are currently have a .500 record after 30 games, sitting at the eighth spot in the Western Conference. They have a Christmas Day game Thursday against the Dallas Mavericks and their rookie sensation Cooper Flagg at Chase Center in San Francisco.

"I think we're headed in the right direction," Green said to reporters Monday. "No one's happy about being 15-15. But I think we're starting to figure out different things, rotations and who we are as a team so I think that's all starting to come together and we're looking a lot better."

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Steve Kerr apologizes for argument with Draymond Green.

title: Patriots List 15 Players On Injury Report Ahead Of Jets Game

Of those 15 players, eight did not participate at all. The following players did not participate in practice: TreVeyon Henderson, DeMario Douglas, Morgan Moses, Thayer Munford Jr., [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The New England Patriots have a chance to clinch the AFC East in Week 17, but may be shorthanded.

The Patriots listed 15 players on Wednesday‚Äôs injury report. Of those 15 players, eight did not participate at all. The following players did not participate in practice:

TreVeyon Henderson, DeMario Douglas, Morgan Moses, Thayer Munford Jr., Milton Williams, Anfernee Jennings and Charles Woods were listed as limited participants. Williams‚Äôs 21-day practice window is open, and the Patriots can activate him at any point.

Not only is the Patriots‚Äô Wednesday injury report long, but it also features some of the most important players on the team. With Hollins, Boutte and Douglas all on the injury report, the Patriots could be thin in the wide receiver room for their game against the New York Jets.

The Patriots could lean on rookie wide receiver Kyle Williams more this week. He has proven he can make big plays this season, and needs just one more 30-plus yard touchdown to tie Randy Moss‚Äôs franchise record for 30-plus yard touchdowns in a single season.

If Wilson is unable to play, Ben Brown figures to draw another start. Spillane has not played since Dec. 1 against the New York Giants. Williams is unlikely to be activated this week, but his limited participation is a good sign that he will be ready to go when the playoffs start.

The Patriots can clinch the division and at least one home playoff game with a win and a Buffalo Bills loss or tie. The Patriots can also clinch the division if they tie and the Bills lose.

title: FIU vs UTSA Prediction, Picks & Odds for December 26 ‚Äî First Responder Bowl
description: Our FIU vs. UTSA predictions expect the battle-tested Roadrunners to rise to the occasion in the First Responder Bowl.
fullText:
We should be in for an entertaining matchup on Friday night when the Florida International Panthers meet the UTSA Roadrunners in the First Responder Bowl.

The Panthers are playing in their first bowl game in six years, and just their sixth since the program‚Äôs inception in 2002, but getting their third bowl victory ever will be difficult against this Roadrunners offense.

See why I like the Roadrunners to get the job done in my Florida International vs. UTSA predictions and college football picks for Friday night‚Äôs First Responder Bowl!

UTSA is the better team, with the better quarterback and the more effective defense. The Roadrunners will utilize their ground game and limit FIU‚Äôs scoring opportunities en route to a win.

It makes sense to look at the 7-5 record for the Florida International Panthers, compared to the UTSA Roadrunners' mark of 6-6, and assume they might be a bit better.

However, according to Jeff Sagarin, the Panthers played a weaker strength of schedule this season than Illinois State and North Dakota.

And if you‚Äôre thinking neither of those is an FBS school, then you‚Äôd be correct.

Despite facing such a weak schedule, the Panthers rank 104th in offensive EPA, 103rd in rushing success, and 105th in rushing defense success rate. They also allow 3.77 points per quality drive, ranking 94th in FBS.

That‚Äôs what happens when you get dominated at the line of scrimmage on defense. The Panthers allow the third-most yards before contact of any FBS team, giving up 2.87 line yards. They also generate little pressure without blitzing heavily.

That‚Äôs great news for a UTSA offensive line that ranks 29th in line yards and 34th in pressure rate allowed. Their backs also rank 20th in yards after contact in the ground game, which is why they‚Äôre 43rd in EPA/rush.

Owen McCown is the better quarterback in this game, and he threw for 370 yards and four touchdowns as he led the Roadrunners to an upset win over Tulane. That‚Äôs by far a better win than any FIU posted this season.

The FIU defense ranks in the 100s in explosive run rate allowed, early down EPA, and stuff rate. Its offense posts very few explosive pass plays, struggles on third down, and is among the most penalized in college football.

UTSA played a tougher schedule, and yet still posted far better metrics on offense and defense. I‚Äôll take the team with the better roster, even with some defections, laying less than a touchdown.

The UTSA offense can put up explosive plays, especially against this FIU defense. It‚Äôs a big reason why the Over is 6-1 in the last seven games for the Roadrunners as they‚Äôve averaged 37 points over that span.

And while FIU‚Äôs not as good as UTSA, that‚Äôs not to say the Panthers won‚Äôt light up the scoreboard themselves. The Over has cashed in three of their last four as they‚Äôve scored 34+ in all three of those contests.

As good as UTSA plays on the whole, the Roadrunners have allowed 34 plays of at least 30 yards this season. FIU has shown an ability to hit big runs, despite the iffy line play, and USF rushed for 7.4 yards a pop against UTSA earlier this season.

It might take some garbage-time offense, but even at 59.5, I think the total is a bit lower than it should be.

Moneyline: FIU +200 | UTSA -250

Over/Under: Over 59.5 | Under 59.5

UTSA has cashed the first-half Over in six of their last seven games for +4.90 units and a 62% ROI. Find more college football betting trends for FIU vs UTSA.
